page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content:
Delamere/Eddisbury
{TRANSPORT Roads The forest,& indeed our entire area is bisected by only one 'B' category road -the B5152 which runs from Frodsham in the north to a junction south of Tarporley where it joins the A49 Trunk road. There are several 'C' category roads in the area, the largest of which runs through the forest in an east-west direction from Hatchmere to Brine's Brow.
Railways. A railway also runs east to west & it connects Manchester & Chester.At the s.e.corner of the forest is the now unmanned Delamere station,but trains still stop here.In the forest there are 6 railway cuttings & 1 embankment.
